I'm the Solent International Student Assistant, designed to help international students navigate university life.
I'm your virtual assistant for international students at Solent University.
You can call me SISA - Solent International Student Assistant!

For visa information, you should contact Solent's International Student Support team at international.support@solent.ac.uk. They can provide guidance on Tier 4/Student visas, BRPs, and visa extensions.
Solent's International Student Advisers can help with visa questions. Visit them at the Student Hub or email international.support@solent.ac.uk.
Visa requirements depend on your country of origin. The International Student Support team can provide personalized advice for your situation.
Solent offers various accommodation options including Chantry Student Village, Hamwic Student Village, and Kimber Student Village. Details are available at solent.ac.uk/accommodation.
As an international student, you're guaranteed accommodation if you apply by the deadline. Contact accommodation@solent.ac.uk for specific questions.
Solent's accommodation ranges from en-suite rooms to shared facilities. Prices range from £120-£180 per week depending on the type. The Accommodation Office can provide current rates.
International student registration happens during Welcome Week. Bring your passport, visa/BRP, and original qualifications. Visit solent.ac.uk/welcome for the schedule.
To register, you'll need to complete online enrollment before arrival and then attend in-person registration to get your student ID card.
Registration for courses typically happens after general university registration. Your faculty will guide you through module selection.

International student tuition fees vary by course, typically between £13,000-£16,000 per year for undergraduate and £14,000-£18,000 for postgraduate programs. Check solent.ac.uk/international-fees for exact figures.
You can pay tuition fees in full or in installments. The first payment is due during registration. Contact student.funding@solent.ac.uk for payment options.
Solent offers some scholarships for international students. Visit solent.ac.uk/international-scholarships to see if you qualify.
International student orientation usually takes place the week before regular Welcome Week. You'll receive details by email with dates and schedule.
Orientation includes campus tours, registration sessions, and social events to help you settle in. Don't miss it!
International orientation will help you meet other students, learn about support services, and complete important paperwork. Check your university email for details.
Solent's main campus facilities include the Mountbatten Library, Sports Complex, Student Union, multiple cafes, and computer labs across campus.
The Mountbatten Library is open 24/7 during term time and offers study spaces, computers, and resources. Your student ID gives you access.
Campus wifi is available throughout university buildings. Connect to 'Solent' network using your student login credentials.
International students on courses longer than 6 months can access the NHS. You should register with a local GP (doctor) when you arrive. The university can help you find one.
Solent offers wellbeing services including counseling and mental health support. Visit solent.ac.uk/wellbeing or email wellbeing@solent.ac.uk.
If you need immediate medical attention, visit the campus health center or call 111 for non-emergency advice. For emergencies, call 999.
Southampton has good bus and train connections. Students get discounts with a valid ID. The Unilink bus service connects university campuses and popular student areas.
You can get a student railcard for 1/3 off train travel. Apply online or at the train station with proof of student status.
Many students cycle in Southampton. The university has secure bike storage facilities on campus.
International students can open UK bank accounts. You'll need your passport, visa/BRP, and university acceptance letter. Major banks near campus include Santander, HSBC, and NatWest.
The university sometimes arranges bank representatives on campus during orientation to help international students open accounts.
To transfer money internationally, services like TransferWise or your bank's international transfer service are commonly used. Check fees before sending money.
International students on Tier 4/Student visas can typically work up to 20 hours per week during term time and full-time during holidays. Check your visa for specific restrictions.
Solent's Employability Service can help you find part-time work. They offer job listings, CV advice, and interview preparation.
On-campus jobs are posted through the Student Union and university job portal. These are convenient and understand your academic commitments.
Culture shock is normal! The International Student Society organizes events to help you meet people and adjust to life in the UK.
Join student clubs and societies through the Student Union to meet people with similar interests. There are over 100 to choose from!
The university organizes regular cultural and social events for international students. Check the events calendar on the student portal.
Solent offers academic support through the Success Skills team. They provide workshops and one-to-one help with academic writing, research, and study skills.
International students can access additional English language support through in-sessional classes. Contact succeed@solent.ac.uk for details.
Your course leader or academic advisor can provide subject-specific support. Don't hesitate to email them or visit during office hours.
Solent Student Union organizes events, runs clubs and societies, and represents student interests. Visit solentsu.co.uk for more information.
The Student Union building contains social spaces, a cafe, and offices for various student services. It's a great place to meet people!
You can join any of the Student Union's clubs and societies throughout the year. They have everything from sports to cultural groups to academic societies.
If you have a complaint, first try to resolve it with the relevant department. If that doesn't work, the Student Hub can guide you through the formal complaints procedure.
For academic appeals or complaints, consult your course handbook for the proper procedure or speak with your course representative.
The university takes student feedback seriously. You can also raise issues through your course rep or the Student Union.
Graduation ceremonies usually take place in July and November. Details are sent to your university email a few months before.
International students can request letter confirmations for visa purposes if they need to stay for graduation after their course ends.
After graduation, you can join the Solent Alumni network to stay connected and access certain university resources.
Southampton has a mild climate. Summers (June-August) average 16-22°C, while winters (December-February) range from 2-10°C. Rain is common year-round, so bring a waterproof jacket!
UK weather can change quickly, so layering clothes is recommended. Winters require a warm coat, gloves, and umbrella.
The academic year spans different seasons, so bring a variety of clothing. Most buildings are heated in winter, but older accommodations can sometimes feel drafty.
The main university breaks are Christmas (mid-December to early January), Easter (usually 3-4 weeks in March/April), and summer (June to September). Check solent.ac.uk/term-dates for exact dates.
During university holidays, most campus facilities operate with reduced hours. International students can stay in university accommodation during Christmas and Easter breaks.
Some courses may have reading weeks mid-semester. Check your specific course calendar for these shorter breaks.
Southampton is a vibrant city with shopping at WestQuay, historical sites like the Medieval Walls, and green spaces like Southampton Common. The waterfront area is popular for restaurants and views.
Nearby attractions include the New Forest National Park, historic Winchester, and beaches at Bournemouth (30 minutes by train).
The city has a diverse range of restaurants, cinemas, theaters, and nightlife. Check out Bedford Place and Oxford Street for popular student venues.
Southampton is generally safe, but like any city, be aware of your surroundings. Campus security is available 24/7 at 023 8031 9999 for emergencies.
The UK emergency number is 999 for police, fire, or ambulance. For non-emergencies, call 101 for police or 111 for health advice.
All university accommodations have security features. If you live off-campus, ensure your housing has proper locks and don't leave valuables visible.
For the most current COVID-19 information and university protocols, please check solent.ac.uk/covid or email covid.support@solent.ac.uk.
If you're experiencing COVID-19 symptoms, please follow current UK health guidelines and notify the university through the student portal.
International students should check both UK government and their home country requirements for travel and vaccination status.
The Mountbatten Library is open 24/7 during term time. You can borrow books using your student ID card at the self-service machines.
The library provides access to physical and digital resources, including books, journals, and databases. Library staff can help with research queries.
You can book study rooms and computer facilities through the library website. Quiet study areas are available on certain floors.
Connect to 'Solent' WiFi using your student ID and password. Coverage extends across campus buildings and university accommodation.
For IT issues, contact the IT Service Desk at 023 8031 9999 or visit them on the ground floor of the library.
Students get free access to Office 365 and other software. Log in with your student email at portal.office.com.
Solent's Access Solent team provides support for students with disabilities or learning difficulties. Contact them at access@solent.ac.uk to discuss your needs.
You may be eligible for Disabled Students' Allowance (DSA) to cover study-related costs. The Access team can help with applications.
If you need learning adjustments for exams or assignments, contact Access Solent as early as possible to arrange this.
